meanings.definition: A rod or staff held by a ruling monarch as an emblem of authority.
meanings.sent1: The king held his golden scepter high during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The queen's scepter was adorned with precious jewels.
meanings.sent3: The scepter seemed to whisper secrets to the royal court.
meanings.sent4: Her scepter of power shone brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The scepter's intricate carvings told tales of ancient rulers.

meanings.definition: To invest with a scepter; confer a scepter upon.
meanings.sent1: The queen will scepter the prince on his coronation day.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony will scepter the new ruler with authority.
meanings.sent3: Sceptering the knight with a toy scepter brought laughter to the court.
meanings.sent4: The magical wand sceptered the wizard with extraordinary powers.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ritual sceptered the chosen one as the rightful heir.
